ca.uqac.lif.fs

Class RamDisk

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.fs.RamDisk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlatFileSystem, PersistentFileSystem, ReadZipFile

    public class RamDisk
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileSystem
    A file system where files are stored in memory.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

      • open

        public void open()
          throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Starts the interaction with the file system. All operations invoked on a file system will throw a FileSystemException if called before this method.
        Specified by:
        open in interface FileSystem
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the interaction with the file system cannot be started

      • close

        public void close()
           throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Stops the interaction with the file system. All operations invoked on a file system will throw a FileSystemException if called after this method.
        Specified by:
        close in interface FileSystem
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if an error occurred while stopping the interaction with the file system

      • writeTo

        public java.io.OutputStream writeTo(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Writes data to a file. The method provides an OutputStream to which data can be printed. The data is guaranteed to be committed to the file only when the print stream is closed. Whether data is written before that moment depends on the actual file system implementation.
        Specified by:
        writeTo in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        An output stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • readFrom

        public java.io.InputStream readFrom(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Reads data from a file. The method provides an InputStream from which data can be read. Consumers of this input stream have the responsibility to close the stream after usage.
        Specified by:
        readFrom in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        A print stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason
